<letter id="smd7902">
<recipient first="" last="" type="individual"/>
</p><p>
Wednesday, <a rel='day origin' value='22'>22d</a> <a rel="month origin" value="10">October</a>, Linwood [ Louisiana ], [<a href='/results.php?year=1862' rel='origin'>1862</a>]
</p><p>
We left <a href='/results.php?city=clinton' rel='city'>Clinton</a> this morning, and have just now arrived by the cars. Charlie came in last evening, to our great surprise, so we did not scruple to leave Lilly. . . . 
</p><p>
The <a href='/results.php?city=baton rouge' rel='city'>Baton Rouge</a> party returned late this evening. In spite of all preparation, Gibbes was horrified at the appearance of home. 
</p><p>
</letter>
